verses.roman:
duṅhā dekhi' nityānanda-prabhu mahā-raṅge
ṭhārāṭhāri kari' hāse bhakta-gaṇa-saṅge

synonyms: duṅhā dekhi'-seeing both of Them; nityānanda-prabhu—Lord Nityānanda Prabhu; mahā-raṅge—in great jubilation; ṭhārāṭhāri—indication; kari'-doing; hāse—laughs; bhakta-gaṇa-saṅge—along with the other devotees.
translation: When Nityānanda saw both the Gopāla Deity and Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu in that way, He began to exchange remarks with the devotees, all of whom were smiling.
